sen.j: 称光天皇（しょうこうてんのう 応永8年3月29日(1401年5月12日) - 正長元年7月20日（1428年8月30日）； 在位： 応永19年8月29日（1412年10月5日） - 正長元年7月20日（1428年8月30日）は、室町時代の第101代天皇である。
sen.e: Emperor Shoko (May 12th, 1401 - August 30th, 1428), his reign was October 5th, 1412 - August 30th, 1428, he was the hundred and first Emperor of the Muromachi period.
Emperor Shoko (May 12th, 1401 - August 30th, 1428), his reign was from October 5th, 1412 to August 30th, 1428, he was the hundred and first Emperor of the Muromachi period.
Emperor Shoko (May 12, 1401 - August 30, 1428), his reign was from October 5, 1412 to August 30, 1428, he was the hundred and first Emperor of the Muromachi period.

sen.j: 名ははじめ躬仁（みひと）、のち實仁（みひと）に改めた。
sen.e: His first name was initially Mishito, later changed to Mihito. (same name but different kanji character)
His first name was initially Mishito, later changed to Mihito. (same name but different kanji character)
His first name was initially Mihito (躬仁), later changed to Mihito (實仁). (same name but different kanji character)
sen.cmt: Mishito→Mihito理解を助けるため、漢字を補足

sen.j: 系譜
sen.e: Genealogy
Genealogy
Genealogy

sen.j: 後小松天皇の第一皇子。
sen.e: He was the first Prince of Emperor Go-Komatsu.
He was the first Prince of Emperor Go-Komatsu.
He was the first Prince of Emperor Gokomatsu.

sen.j: 母は、権大納言日野資教の養女、光範門院・藤原資子（日野西資子。
sen.e: His mother was Gon Dainagon,(the authority of the position after the Minister, equivalent rank of Sukenori HINO's adopted daughter, Kohanmon in, FUJIWARA no Sukeko (Sukeko HINO HISHI).
sen.cmt: 権大納言→Gon Dainagon[定訳不明]
sen.e: His mother was Gon Dainagon,(the authority of the position after the Minister, equivalent rank of Sukenori HINO's adopted daughter, Kohanmon in, FUJIWARA no Sukeko (Sukeko HINO HISHI).

His mother was Gon Dainagon (an official position below Minister under the government based on the ritsuryo legal codes, equivalent to the rank of Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank)), Sukenori HINO's adopted daughter, Kohanmon-in, FUJIWARA no Sukeko (Sukeko HINO HISHI).
sen.cmt: ハイフン補足Gon Dainagon に説明を付けました。

sen.j: 実父は日野資国）
sen.e: His real father was Sukekuni HINO.
His real father was Sukekuni HINO.
His real father was Sukekuni HINO.

sen.j: 略歴
sen.e: Biography
Biography
Brief Personal History

sen.j: 1412年8月29日に後小松天皇の譲位を受けて即位（即位日は、1414年12月19日）。
sen.e: On August 29th, 1412 he enthroned after Emperor Go-Komatsu passed the throne to him. (the enthronement date was December 19th, 1414.)
On August 29th, 1412 he was enthroned after Emperor Go-Komatsu passed the throne to him. (the enthronement date was December 19th, 1414.)
On August 29, 1412 he was enthroned after Emperor Gokomatsu passed the throne to him. (the enthronement date was December 19, 1414.)

sen.j: 足利義満とは日野氏を挟んで外戚関係にあり、日野資国の妹の業子は義満の正室だった。
sen.e: He had a maternal relationship with Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA through HINO clan, Sukekuni HINO's sister, Nariko (Gyoshi) was Yoshinitsu's wife.
He had a maternal relationship with Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA through the HINO clan, Sukekuni HINO's sister, Nariko (Gyoshi) was Yoshinitsu's wife.
He had a maternal relationship with Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA through the Hino clan, Sukekuni Hino's sister, Nariko (Gyoshi) was Yoshimitsu's wife.

sen.j: 『看聞日記』によれば、足利義持が当初の諱である躬仁の「躬」の字には“身に弓があるのは難がある”として鄂隠慧カツに相談し、「躬」と同音の「實」とすることにした。
sen.e: According to "Kanmon Diary" (Kanmon Nikki), Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA mentioned about the kanji character of Emperor's initial posthumous name, 'Mihito', saying "it is not ideal to have an archery with the body", he then consulted with Gakuin Ekatsu and changed the kanji character from '躬' (Mihito) to '實' (Mihito).
sen.cmt: 看聞日記→Kanmon Diary [Kanmon Nikki] 諱→personal name[いみな]
sen.e: According to the "Kanmon Diary" (Kanmon Nikki), Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA referred to the kanji character of Emperor's initial posthumous name, 'Mihito', saying "it is not ideal to have an archery bow together with a body," he then consulted with Gakuin Ekatsu and changed the kanji character from '躬' (Mihito) to '實' (Mihito).
sen.cmt: words revised for readability and correctness
sen.e: According to the "Kanmon Nikki" (Kanmon Diary), Yoshimitsu ASHIKAGA referred to the kanji character of the Emperor's initial posthumous name, 'Mihito', saying "it is not ideal to have an archery bow together with a body," he then consulted with Gakuin Ekatsu and changed the kanji character from '躬' (Mihito) to '實' (Mihito).
sen.cmt: 定冠詞必要。 “of Emperor's ”=> “of the Emperor's ”

sen.j: 後小松上皇が院政を行っていたが、生来病気がちであり、嗣子に恵まれなかったことから、後小松上皇は、伏見宮家より後花園天皇を猶子に迎え後継者とした。
sen.e: Although the ex-Emperor Go-Komatsu ruled the cloister government at that time, since he was not well and did not have any children, he adopted Emperor Go-Hanazono from Fushimi no Miya Family to let him succeed to the Imperial throne.

Although the ex-Emperor Go-Komatsu ruled the cloistered government at that time, since he was not well and did not have any children, he adopted Emperor Go-Hanazono from the Fushimi no Miya Family to allow him to succeed to the Imperial throne.

Although the retired Emperor Gokomatsu ruled the cloistered government at that time, since he was not well and did not have any children, he adopted Emperor Gohanazono from the Fushimi no Miya family to allow him to succeed to the Imperial throne.

sen.j: ために見るべき実績がなく、さらには弟小川宮との死別、父帝との不和など家庭内の問題が原因で精神を病むなど、不運な帝であった。
sen.e: He did not have much achievement and his younger brother, Ogawa no Miya died, he did not have good relationship with his father and it caused mental problem, he did not have much luck in his life.
sen.cmt: 原文 「ために見るべき実績がなく」 の意味が不明でした。
sen.e: He did not achieve much and his younger brother, Ogawa no Miya died, he did not enjoy a good relationship with his father and it caused mental problems, he did not have much good fortune during his life.
sen.cmt: revised words for smoother reading and correctness
sen.e: He did not achieve much and his younger brother, Ogawa no Miya died, he did not enjoy a good relationship with his father and it caused mental problems, he did not have much good fortune during his life.

sen.j: 1428年（正長元）年7月20日、28歳で崩御。
sen.e: He died on July 20th, 1428 when he was twenty eight years old.
He died on July 20th, 1428 when he was twenty eight years old.
He died on July 20, 1428 when he was twenty eight years old.

sen.j: 諡号・追号・異名
sen.e: Posthumous name, Tsuigo, Different name
Posthumous name, Tsuigo, Different name
Posthumous name, Tsuigo, Different name

sen.j: 追号「称光院」は、天武系の第48代称徳天皇と天智系の第49代光仁天皇の一字づつを取ったものである。
sen.e: His posthumous name, 'Shoko in' came from the name by taking one character of the forty eighth Emperor Shotoku of the Imperial line from the Emperor Tenmu, and one from the forty ninth Emperor Konin of the Imperial line from the Emperor Tenji.
sen.cmt: 天武系→the Imperial line from the Emperor Tenmu[定訳不明] 天智系→the Imperial line from the Emperor Tenji[定訳不明]
sen.e: His posthumous name, 'Shoko in' came about by taking one character of the forty eighth Emperor Shotoku of Imperial lineage, from the Emperor Tenmu, and one from the forty ninth Empero,r, Konin, of Imperial lineage and from the Emperor Tenji.

His posthumous name, 'Shoko-in,' was created by combining "sho," the first character from the name of Emperor Shotoku (the forty-eighth emperor, who was descended from Emperor Tenmu) and "ko," the first character from the name of Emperor Konin (the forty-ninth emperor, who was descended from Emperor Tenji).
sen.cmt: Shoko in→Shoko-inforty eighthとforty ninthにハイフン入れる天武系と天智系の意味がわかるように訳出し直しました。

sen.j: 在位中の元号

sen.e: Oei (August 29, 1412) - April 27, 1428

Oei (August 29, 1412) - April 27, 1428
Shocho April 27, 1428 - (July 20, 1428)
Shocho April 27, 1428 - (July 20, 1428)

sen.e: The Imperial mausoleum
The Imperial mausoleum
The Imperial mausoleum

sen.j: 京都府京都市伏見区深草坊町の深草北陵（ふかくさのきたのみささぎ）に葬られた。
sen.e: The Emperor was entombed in Fukakusa no Kita no Misasagi at Fukakusa Bo-cho Town, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
The Emperor was entombed in Fukakusa no Kita no Misasagi at Fukakusa Bo-cho Town, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
The Emperor was entombed in Fukakusa no Kita no Misasagi at Fukakusa Bo-cho Town, Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
